column4: i just installed 8.04 dual boot on an old toshiba (256MB RAM) and power dies after booting - any ideas why?
power dies is kinda non descript, what exactly does happen
you push button, do you see the bios?
after logging into ubuntu?
it's on ac constantly?
correct
does it happen when you boot into recovery?
how do i do that - from grub?
yeah in grub try the rescue option
okay brb
I'm in root shell and it's fine, what now
what was on the laptop before you reinstalled?
XP
855GM Intel integrated graphics
if you dont actually login, but just let the machine load the logon screen, does it crash/hang or reboot?
let me try
dont really have a clue as how to solve it though, seems there's an issue with the graphics, could try ubuntu 8.10, it has a better intel driver?
graphics driver even
it's a very old machine, only 256MB RAM, will it run okay?
not really :/
maybe a little better with xfce
maybe a lighter distro?
LXDE might work too
worth trying i suppose , but i dont know any
